roleset.name: suspend, suspending (spatial, non-lethal sense)
roleset.note: HANG-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls put_spatial-9.2-1, spray-9.7-1, poison-42.2, spatial_configuration-47.6, crane-40.3.2. (from hang.01-v)

HANGING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hang.01. Corresponds to VNcls VNcls put_spatial-9.2-1, spray-9.7-1, poison-42.2, spatial_configuration-47.6, crane-40.3.2, assuming_position-50. (from hanging.01-n)

role.descr: agent, entity causing something to be suspended

example.name: usually ergative
example.text: With uncertainty still hanging over interest rates and the dollar, the market failed to find a focus that might lead to further investor commitments, they said.
example.arg: over interest rates and the dollar

example.name: with agent
example.text: John hung his toy soldiers from the ceiling fan.

example.name: all args
example.text: That's, in fact, a part of the point of his hanging it on the wall.

roleset.name: exist, be (cool)
roleset.note: HANG-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls spatial_configuration-47.6, assuming_position-50. (from hang.02-v)
HANGING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hang.02. Corresponds to VNcls spatial_configuration-47.6, assuming_position-50. (from hanging.02-n)

example.name: semi-phrasal
example.text: However, the only outsider who has emerged to lead such a shareholder vote, Los Angeles investor Marvin Davis, who triggered the buy-out with a $5.4 billion bid in early August, is hanging back -- apparently to avoid being blamed for contributing to the deal's collapse.
example.arg: the only outsider who has emerged to lead such a shareholder vote, Los Angeles investor Marvin Davis, who triggered the buy-out with a $5.4 billion bid in early August
to avoid being blamed for contributing to the deal's collapse

example.name: metaphorical and fixed
example.text: The trial of the case lasted seven months and ended in September with a hung jury.

example.name: with COM
example.text: As her father, George Hambley Brown, was a prominent figure in the British film industry, she hung with the British actors of her day.
example.arg: As her father, George Hambley Brown, was a prominent figure in the British film industry
with the British actors of her day

example.name: both args
example.text: With the brightness of the light shining down on him and their hanging back in the shadows, he could only make out their most basic features.

roleset.name: wait
roleset.note: HANG_ON-V NOTES: Often used in the imperative. No VNcls. (from hang.04-v)
HANGING_ON-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hang.04. No VNcls. (from hanging.04-n)

example.name: imperative
example.text: *PRO* hang on Jay.

example.name: both args
example.text: Then you-1 are asked [*-1]-2 *pro*-2 to hang on for the next available consultant.

example.name: both args
example.text: He does not have to justify himself; his presidency for life, which is the real meaning of his hanging on for a third term...

roleset.name: maintain possession of
roleset.note: HANGING_ON-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hang.05 (from hanging.05-n)

example.name: no benefcative
example.text: [They]-1 also need *-1 to hang on to somewhat more secure open seats in Maryland and Vermont as well as fourteen other incumbents.
example.arg: to somewhat more secure open seats in Maryland and Vermont as well as fourteen other incumbents.

example.name: all args (imperative)
example.text: Do me a favor and *pro* hang on to my purse for m

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: he finally comes to realise that maybe his views and his hanging on to the past need revision after all.

roleset.name: hang up: terminate a phone call, hanging_up
roleset.note: HANGING_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hang.03. No VNcls. (from hanging.03-n)

roles.note: This really probably needs to have arg1 split up into 2 args. (from hang.03-v) verb frame's arg1 contained 2 separate arguments that could co-occur, so I've broken them up here. (from hanging.03-n)

example.name: hang up on
example.text: John always hangs up on telemarketers.

example.name: hang up the phone
example.text: John hung up the phone.

example.name: all args
example.text: I asked him some basic questions about the economy that he couldn't answer, which resulted in his hanging up the phone on me.

roleset.name: spend time socially
roleset.note: HANG_OUT-V NOTES: Frame file for 'hang out' based on instances in Webtext 2.5-76-199. No VerbNet class. Comparison to hang.02. Framed by Claire (from hang.06-v)

role.descr: Focus person kickin' it, or all persons in one mention
Other person that arg 1 is kickin' it with, when separate mention

example.name: Let's hang out sometime!
example.text: Most of all , Abather-1 enjoyed *PRO*-1 hanging out with the Americans.

roleset.name: by the neck, execution
roleset.note: HANGING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No corresponding VNcls (from hanging.06-n)

role.descr: thing that the person is hanged from (e.g. gallows)

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: The murderer was hanged at the gallows.

example.name: args 1, 3
example.text: John Brown was against his hanging for treason because he believed that he was fighting against an immoral, unjust and extremely inhumane institution ...

example.name: arg 1, location
example.text: The assassin was hanged in public in the market square.
